Volunteers placed these flags in front of Bridle Ridge Elementary School to commemorate Sept. 11, 2001.

More than 2,500 flags were placed throughout the community, including all 7 elementary schools, both middle schools, the high school, the Administrative Services Center, three fire stations, and city hall/police department. More than 20 families participated in this year's flag project.

The project, coordinated by parent Kristi Schumacher of Raymore, was started in 2017 when three families placed 500 flags at two elementary schools.

Thank you to everyone who participated!

shared_text:
Raymore Arts Commission
August 27 at 7:12 PM ¬∑

Raymore Arts Commission Chair Loren Jones presented a donation of $2,600 to the Raymore-Peculiar School District at the Aug. 27 school board meeting.

"We know this school year may be one of the most challenging years that teachers and students will experience in light of the drastic changes to everyday life that have come along with the COVID-19 pandemic," Jones said. "It is our pleasure to be involved in a small way to support the arts in Ray-Pec schools and to show our appreciation to the teachers who do so much for their students."

The donation from the Raymore Arts Commission will be distributed equally between the district's 12 art teachers and the Schull Early Learning Center to use as needed for supplies for the 2020-2021 school year.

Raymore Arts Commission Chair Loren Jones presented a donation of $2,600 to the Raymore-Peculiar School District at the Aug. 27 school board meeting.

"We know this school year may be one of the most challenging years that teachers and students will experience in light of the drastic changes to everyday life that have come along with the COVID-19 pandemic," Jones said. "It is our pleasure to be involved in a small way to support the arts in Ray-Pec schools and to show our appreciation to the teachers who do so much for their students."

The donation from the Raymore Arts Commission will be distributed equally between the district's 12 art teachers and the Schull Early Learning Center to use as needed for supplies for the 2020-2021 school year.

In these challenging times, we truly recognize and appreciate how educators play such a pivotal role in our children's lives. Our Ray-Pec teachers are doing an incredible job inspiring our students' love of learning and discovery and making a difference in their well-being and long-term success.

Even as they work with students from a distance, teachers change the lives of children every day. And with the abrupt end to the physical school year, our teachers have done even more to continue education with virtual classrooms and learning at home lessons -- all to ensure every student has the tools they need to reach their full potential.

Teacher Appreciation Week is May 4-8, and Teacher Appreciation Day is May 5.

Here are some ways to show appreciation:
Email heartfelt letters, cards and messages of appreciation
Create artwork, poems and video messages to celebrate your teachers
On Thursday, upload a #TBT of you and your favorite teacher and thank them using #ThankATeacher or #ThankARayPecTeacher

The School District continues to mourn the passing of Max Herrick, who died Saturday night in a multi-vehicle accident on I-49. Max worked from December 1990 to July 2009 in the Ray-Pec Buildings and Grounds Department, first as a custodian and then handling other duties. He was well-known as the high school security and parking lot attendant, as shown in the first picture from 2007.

A private family funeral is planned for May 11 with a celebration of life at a later date. Herrick, a Vietnam Veteran, will be buried at Higginsville Veterans Cemetery.

Link to obituary: https://www.atkinsonfuneralhome.com/obituary/max-herrick-jr

Link to Fox4 news story: https://fox4kc.com/news/metro-family-loses-patriarch-in-i-49-crash-hours-after-saying-goodbye-to-another-family-member/

Megan Allen is a Ray-Pec High School senior in English 4 who passionately participated in the Senior DRIVE Projects.

She worked tirelessly throughout the school year organizing fundraisers, contacting potential donors, and researching best practices.
